block.p: EMC CORP., Hopkinton, Mass., the No. 1 maker of computer storage systems, said it would split its stock two shares for one on June 2 to shareholders of record as of May 19.

CAROLINA POWER AND LIGHT CO., Raleigh, N.C., the owner of the No. 2 utility in North Carolina, said it would sell a 65 percent stake in its Internet unit, Interpath Communications Inc., to the closely held Bain Capital Inc., Boston, a buyout firm, for $50 million.
EMC CORP., Hopkinton, Mass., the No. 1 maker of computer storage systems, said it would split its stock two shares for one on June 2 to shareholders of record as of May 19.

CAROLINA POWER AND LIGHT CO., Raleigh, N.C., the owner of the No. 2 utility in North Carolina, said it would sell a 65 percent stake in its Internet unit, Interpath Communications Inc., to the closely held Bain Capital Inc., Boston, a buyout firm, for $50 million.

CAIS INTERNET INC., Washington, which provides Internet access services, said Microsoft Corp., Redmond, Wash., had agreed to invest $40 million and help create specialized Web content for hotel guests.
COOPER TIRE AND RUBBER CO., Findlay, Ohio, the seventh-largest tire maker in the world, said it planned to buy back $134 million of common stock, or 14 percent of its outstanding shares.
